1048668522832941058.text: My statement on today’s Senate vote to send Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court: https://t.co/XkroSl74mS

1047943802042941441.text: The American people deserve more information, not less, when we are talking about a lifetime position on the Supreme Court. (4/4)

1047943801103368192.text: The Trump Administration purposely limited the scope of the investigation, excluding not just Judge Kavanaugh and Dr. Ford, but several other key witnesses from being interviewed. (3/4)

1047943800142929920.text: While I have the upmost respect for the men and women of the FBI, it is clear that the restrictions placed on the FBI by the Trump administration did not allow for a proper or credible investigation. (2/4)

1047943799354417154.text: I believe any credible and thorough FBI investigation should include interviews with the two key witnesses – Judge Kavanaugh and Dr. Ford.  That did not happen. (1/4)

1045749742163103744.text: Read my full statement on the Senate Judiciary Committee vote to send Judge Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination to the full Senate. https://t.co/bLCM1QT0yl

1045749740934172673.text: This rushed process shows, yet again, that Senate Republicans will continue to place politics and party over people. We need a Supreme Court that believes survivors and that serves justice to all - not a select, privileged few.

1045749739986329605.text: When stories such as Dr. Ford's aren't thoroughly investigated it serves as a chilling message to the next generation: the voices of girls, women, and sexual assault survivors don't matter.
